Reason: The configuration option _h is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the execution time and memory consumption of the Catena password hashing algorithm. The _h configuration is used as the main hash function in various critical functions such as hashing passwords, computing key streams, and performing key derivation. These operations are time-expensive and memory-expensive, leading to notable performance variations at the system level. Additionally, the _h configuration is triggered frequently during password hashing operations, further emphasizing its performance sensitivity.
